```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library('tidyverse')
example <- read.csv("~/universita/algoritmi/c/project/example3.csv")
```


```{r cars}
tail(example)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
example %>%
  filter(grepl("fill with period", string)) %>%
  mutate(ti= log(time), s= log(size))%>%
  ggplot(aes(s,ti, color=label))+ 
  geom_smooth()+geom_point()

  

```
```{r}
example%>%
  ggplot(aes(result))+
  geom_histogram()
```
```{r}
example %>%
  filter(grepl("fill with period", string)) %>%
  mutate(ti= log(time))%>%
   group_by(label, size) %>%
  summarise(t = mean(ti)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(log(size),t, color=label))+ 
  geom_smooth()+geom_point()
```

```{r}
example %>%
  filter(grepl("fill random", string)) %>%
  mutate(t= log(time), s= log(size))%>%
  ggplot(aes(s,t, color=label))+ 
  geom_point(size=2)+
  geom_smooth()
```


```{r}

example%>%
  mutate(id=row_number()) %>%
  ggplot(aes(id,size))+
  geom_point()
```
